full_summary: ## HVAC Replacement Project – Slave Lake, AB ## Projet de remplacement du système CVCA - Slave Lake (Alberta) --- ### Solicitation Number M5000-22-5688/A ### Procurement Notice Status Cancelled ### Executive Summary This procurement notice announces the intention to replace the existing HVAC system at a Government of Canada Building located in Slave Lake, Alberta. The project involves removing and disposing of the existing furnace and air-conditioning system and installing a new HVAC system. The new system must be energy efficient and include a multizone furnace system, along with HVAC air supply to two rooms. The replacement system must also include relocation of thermostats to exterior rooms. ### Description The project requires the successful contractor to perform and complete the work by December 31, 2023. This is the first phase of a two-phase competition. Phase one will invite bidders to qualify based on mandatory requirements, while Phase two will invite qualified bidders to provide a financial bid on the project based on the specifications and drawings. ### Important Information * Only qualified bidders will be invited to participate in Phase two. * Canada retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement. * Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. * Indigenous businesses are encouraged to participate in this procurement opportunity. * The procurement is subject to security provisions. ### Contact Information For more information about this procurement notice, please contact the following: Sandra Robinson Solicitation Officer Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) 6th Floor, 10065 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, Alberta T5J 3B1 sandra.robinson@rcmp-grc.gc.ca (780) 670-8626 --- ### Document All documents related to this procurement notice are available for download at [Buy and Sell.gc.ca](http://buyandsell.gc.ca). Canada is not responsible for the information found on third-party websites. ### Request for Proposal and Tenders The Request for Qualifications and the Request for Proposal and tenders are available for download on the [Buy and Sell.gc.ca](http://buyandsell.gc.ca) website. --- ### Disclaimer Canada will make available Notices of Proposed Procurement (NPP), bid solicitations, and related documents for download through the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS).
